did.abstract: This collection consists of the files of Gene Carroll, a Cornell University faculty member and co-director of the New York State AFL-CIO/Cornell Union Leadership Institute (ULI).

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gene Carroll is the co-director of the New York State AFL-CIO/Cornell Union Leadership Institute program, which began in 2001 and has more than 450 alumni, most of them based in the metropolitan New York area. The New York State AFL-CIO/Cornell Union Leadership Institute prepares New York's union leaders to more effectively and strategically tackle the tough challenges now facing the labor movement. The Institute is an intensive, one-year executive-level training program for current union leaders and top staff.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: ILR School Extension Division Metropolitan District Office (New York, N.Y.), Gene Carroll Files #/4354/006. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Invitations, speech notes, sign-in sheets, newspaper articles, and correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings on Cornell's finances, unionization efforts by adjuncts and graduate students, Cornell's various campuses, and correspondence re the clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Information on ILR Deans, land grant panel reports, interviews with Lois Gray, materials from the 50th and 60th Anniversaries of the founding of ILR, ULI pamphlets, information on the Buffalo extension offices, and an AdJournal honoring Lois Gray.
